natural problem: Find the domain of the function $a(x) = \sqrt{3^x - 7^x}.$
natural solution: The square root $\sqrt{3^x - 7^x}$ is defined only when $3^x \ge 7^x.$  This is equivalent to $\frac{7^x}{3^x} \le 1,$ or \[\left( \frac{7}{3} \right)^x \le 1.\]This inequality is satisfied exactly when $x \le 0.$  Thus, the domain of the function is $\boxed{(-\infty,0]}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and x :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. a x = sqrt (3 powr x - 7 powr x)"
shows  "x \<le> 0"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the domain of the function $a(x) = \sqrt{3^x - 7^x}.$ The final Answer is (-\infty,0]
 ### Proof
 The square root $\sqrt{3^x - 7^x}$ is defined only when $3^x \ge 7^x.$  This is equivalent to $\frac{7^x}{3^x} \le 1,$ or \[\left( \frac{7}{3} \right)^x \le 1.\]This inequality is satisfied exactly when $x \le 0.$  Thus, the domain of the function is $\boxed{(-\infty,0]}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and x :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. a x = sqrt (3 powr x - 7 powr x)"
shows  "x \<le> 0"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: For the function $a(x) = \sqrt{3^x - 7^x}$, find the condition under which $x$ must be less than or equal to $0$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. a x = sqrt (3 powr x - 7 powr x)"
shows  "Domain a = {x. x \<le> 0}"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the domain of the function $a(x) = \sqrt{3^x - 7^x}.$ The final Answer is (-\infty,0]
 ### Proof
 The square root $\sqrt{3^x - 7^x}$ is defined only when $3^x \ge 7^x.$  This is equivalent to $\frac{7^x}{3^x} \le 1,$ or \[\left( \frac{7}{3} \right)^x \le 1.\]This inequality is satisfied exactly when $x \le 0.$  Thus, the domain of the function is $\boxed{(-\infty,0]}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. a x = sqrt (3 powr x - 7 powr x)"
shows  "Domain a = {x. x \<le> 0}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Find the domain of the function $a(x) = \sqrt{3^x - 7^x}$. The final answer is all $x$ such that $x \leq 0$.

 *)

shows  "UNIV = {x. x \<le> 0}"

  show ?thesis sledgehammer
